snippet: Members of the Senate Intelligence Committee pressed John O. Brennan, the nominee for director of the Central Intelligence Agency, on the secrecy of targeted killings and their legal basis.
abstract: Senate Intelligence Committee members press John O Brennan, the nominee for director of the Central Intelligence Agency, on secrecy in the use of drones for targeted killings, their legal basis and the reported backlash they have produced in Pakistan and Yemen; Sen Dianne Feinstein says she will review proposals to create court to oversee targeted killings.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and SCOTT SHANE

lead_paragraph: Members of the Senate Intelligence Committee pressed John O. Brennan, the nominee for director of the Central Intelligence Agency, on the secrecy of targeted killings and their legal basis.

headline.seo: Senators Press Brennan About C.I.A.’s Drone Strikes
headline.main: Drones Are Focus as C.I.A. Nominee Goes Before Senators
headline.print_headline: Senators Press Choice For C.I.A. On Use Of Drones

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
